		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=174216&sid=e83879d5f2158361e0bc05f90d642c05#174216"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Mon Mar 26, 2007 1:21 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=174216&sid=e83879d5f2158361e0bc05f90d642c05"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody"/><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Kristus wrote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">Intresting..
<br/><br/>
Anyway, I'm questioning the usefulness of the tool. Since it's so liberal in it's usage of polies, it's probably more work to optimize the model than it would be to make it manually.</td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/>
although I haven't tried it, thats what I was thinking, but we could use it for inspiration in the design of some plant models.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=17180&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0" target="_blank" class="postlink">(wip) ratty d3 hell map</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.katsbits.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">katsbits.com</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=177673#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=6541&sid=e83879d5f2158361e0bc05f90d642c05"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=6541&sid=e83879d5f2158361e0bc05f90d642c05"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>     <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="174230"/><b>mikebart</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">fired 300 rounds<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 13 Sep 2004<br/>Posts: 305<br/>Location: Melbourne Australia</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=174230&sid=e83879d5f2158361e0bc05f90d642c05#174230"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Mon Mar 26, 2007 3:08 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=174230&sid=e83879d5f2158361e0bc05f90d642c05"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I think the Ivy generator would be useful for quickly generating highpoly models which could then be projected onto alpha planes for use in game engines.
<br/>
In its current state I dont really think its optimised to be used in <span style="font-style: italic">current</span> gen realtime engines.
<br/>
its pretty new though and Im sure it will be developed into something more useful for games, those guys are pretty clever over at, <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://graphics.uni-konstanz.de/publikationen/" target="_blank">http://graphics.uni-konstanz.de/publikationen/</a> and alot of the stuff they do is actually for realtime environment simulations, so im sure they'l develope it further.
<br/><br/>
Lumpengnom; can you show us some wires and stats of the Ivy?
<br/><br/><br/></span><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Tron wrote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">
<br/><br/>
Since you have all the models though you can't not give us some ingame d3 engine shots, your initial tests looked fantastic!</td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
Ill see how I go with that tron, its just that the time I spend exporting these models to doom3 and then tweaking things in the engine could be better spent building assets, I can usually predict how a model or a texture is going to look in doom3 anyway and I just dont feel the need to put them ingame at the moment but whatever engine I use ill always post my work here.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=160978#160978" target="_blank" class="postlink">Tutorial; Baking Multiple Maps in 3dsmax8. </a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">It might be possible to tie this to a mel script that created layers of low poly target meshes, then group the polies created by this with each plane based on proximity. 		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=177562&sid=e83879d5f2158361e0bc05f90d642c05#177562"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 06, 2007 1:56 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=177562&sid=e83879d5f2158361e0bc05f90d642c05"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I've been getting some stuff in game, thought id better do it now before I end up with 50 odd assets to port to quake4, despite what I said earlier about not bothering <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_confused.gif" alt="Confused" border="0"/>  what a silly idea that was.
<br/>
Its not showing the best fps there, nothing's optimised in regards to textures and it seems to drop about 10 fps when I take a screenshot for some reason, but im not too concerned about the stats at the moment, i should be able to optimise it later if I need to, to get it running decently. Also ill be giving all the assets from my wip to the guys at the Ground Zero mod so you'll probably get hold of them fairly soon to use in your maps.
<br/><br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img264.imageshack.us/my.php?image=wip03sm9.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img264.imageshack.us/img264/5163/wip03sm9.th.jpg" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img264.imageshack.us/my.php?image=wip04vm0.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img264.imageshack.us/img264/1112/wip04vm0.th.jpg" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img264.imageshack.us/my.php?image=wip02fn4.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img264.imageshack.us/img264/2916/wip02fn4.th.jpg" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img264.imageshack.us/my.php?image=wip01tg2.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img264.imageshack.us/img264/5396/wip01tg2.th.jpg" border="0"/></a><br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=160978#160978" target="_blank" class="postlink">Tutorial; Baking Multiple Maps in 3dsmax8. </a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">ThatÂ´s really amazing work. These colors and contrasts youÂ´ve got in your work are next to perfect, imo.<br/>_________________<br/>Leader / <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.coulin.eu/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Pillars: Doom III Total Conversion</a>

<br/>
technology." ~Revolver Ocelot</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
